TopicTitle: [1.3] [Kopernicus] KittopiaTech - a Kopernicus Visual Editor (Release 2) - Sep. 27

Articles.Content:
4 minutes ago, Thomas P. said:

Thats an error in the UI. Nothing related to the config saver. The other issues in the log seem to be related to oceans.

I fixed them and updated the .zip on Github

Ok cool.  But it won't save a  config..  I'll mess around with it more later

Ok cool.  But it won't save a  config..  I'll mess around with it more later

" I fixed them and updated the .zip on Github "

It works now

Just now, Thomas P. said:

" I fixed them and updated the .zip on Github "

It works now

Oh I didn't know thats what you meant. thanks!!!.

Hello, this mod seem to be nice for edit or make planets. Thanks to @Thomas P. !!

For right now I just want to edit existing planets and just change the colors of biomes. I don't know how to do this.
I went into CelestialBody Editor, next into Edit Biomes, I opened the biome I want to edit, and in Edit Color I changed the color of my biome.
Nothing happens on my biome in game, and as there isn't option to update biomes so I figured I need to save changes and may be reload the game. But in main menu, when I click on "Save Body" it doesn't do anything and I get this in console: "Exception: IndexOutOfRangeException: Array index is out of range."

Is there somebody to tell me what I'm doing wrong?

(The only mods installed are: Kopernicus, ModularFlightIntegrator, KittopiaTech)
Extract of my output_log.txt:

On 06/11/2016 at 3:18 AM, ProtoJeb21 said:

@Thomas P. Just a quick question - is Kittopia version-locked to KSP 1.2? (If it is I don't mind)

I'm currently using it in 1.2.2 with no problems

Can the particle effects target an body? because when i set it to sun it doesn't work. the particles disappear. And if if does work, can you add an option so the particles aim away from the object that is targeted?
I'm surprised nobody has shown up with pitchforks yet considering Kittopiatech broke with the latest kopernicus. I'm sure you already know though.

14 hours ago, Galileo said:

I'm surprised nobody has shown up with pitchforks yet considering Kittopiatech broke with the latest kopernicus. I'm sure you already know though. 

I was just going to mention it :p

So how broken is this for the latest version of Kopernicus? It's still up on CKAN. Had it installed briefly and what little I tried to do seemed to work, not that I tried anything complex. Does it break stuff or are parts of it just not quite fully operational?
Released Version 0.6. It is fully compatible with Kopernicus 1.2.2-2 upwards, and I also fixed other stuff (for example the curve editor)

Hi.

Is there a way to edit the science values?

@ProtoJeb21 says it's easy, but I can't seem to figure anything out.

On ‎19‎/‎03‎/‎2017 at 0:28 AM, electricpants said:

Quick question - 

How do you use Kittopia to create color + height maps?

@ProtoJeb21 says it's easy, but I can't seem to figure anything out.

Scroll to the bottom of ScaledVersion and click Update textures

Sorry it seems to be working in 1.3 now strange it wasn't eariler

Hi @Thomas P., I wanted to use Kittopia to resolve a problem I'm having with Planets in a Star System I'm developing, but I can find no form of Tutorial/Documentation for Kittopia.

Do you know of any?

Or can you help with this: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/140580-130-122-kopernicus-release-2-may-30/&do=findComment&comment=3071168

What info do you need?

Thanks in Advance.
So a couple posts up, someone said it was working for them in 1.3, how well does it work for you guys?

15 minutes ago, Spaceception said:

So a couple posts up, someone said it was working for them in 1.3, how well does it work for you guys?

Kittopia has never been at 100% but I would say it's functional. I don't rely on it for everything like some people do so I haven't tested all of it, but the core features seem to work.

You Are Our Savior! I was Using this, and I thought it would not work. Thanks!

I was trying to use this mod, and i didn't found how to use it, until i decided to look carefully at the readme file when redownloading it (i did'nt got it installed at first because it's not in the KittopiaTech folder in the dowload zip, maybe include it inside for next release? ),

so to open the UI you have hit: CTRL+P

Thank you for this mod , i hope it will help me
